Description: Tondo fragment, with part of stem, of Attic red-figured pottery kylix. Outside glazed; inside tondo, two maenads moving to right; the left one, very worn, holds a tambourine in her upraised hand (preserved, part of the lower arms, hands, and tambourine the right arm, hand, and part of the body of the right maenad and right hand holding perhaps a handle).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 109 no. 388 pl. 81)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1752)
